column4:
least tell me the best type of method i should look up..i want it back like it was before
2006-09-11T11:17:00.000Z	TC_		what command do i need to get into root jus type chroot? im very new to linux
2006-09-11T11:17:00.000Z	TC_		no
2006-09-11T11:18:00.000Z	TC_		i mean if im on the live cd
2006-09-11T11:18:00.000Z	TC_		and wanna get into my installed ubuntu
2006-09-11T11:18:00.000Z	TC_		k
2006-09-11T11:19:00.000Z	TC_		u dont get what im saying
2006-09-11T11:19:00.000Z	TC_		i am on the live cd as in not the installed type..but i wanna get into my installed ubuntu so i can update grub
2006-09-11T11:20:00.000Z	bjorn_	TC_	I think 'man dchroot' will help you
2006-09-11T11:21:00.000Z	bjorn_	TC_	sorry, my ba
2006-09-11T11:21:00.000Z	bjorn_	TC_	 you want 'man chroot'
2006-09-11T11:24:00.000Z	bjorn_	TC_	and it should have been /dev/hdb1
2006-09-11T11:34:00.000Z	bjorn_	TC_	who knows, just how it does it I guess
2006-09-11T11:34:00.000Z	TC_	bjorn_	ignored*
2006-09-11T11:35:00.000Z	bjorn_	TC_	'man grub-install'
2006-09-11T11:36:00.000Z	bjorn_	TC_	oh, we're not there yet :D
2006-09-11T11:39:00.000Z	bjorn_	TC_	lost track of the command you R running already . .
2006-09-11T11:40:00.000Z	bjorn_	TC_	well, lets start w/ the first command
2006-09-11T11:42:00.000Z	TC_	bjorn_	 do this???   mkdir /mnt/sdb1 ; mount /dev/sdb1 /mnt/sdb1 ; chroot /mnt/sdb1
